intro: Gouldia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed gouldia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant has oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gouldia rotundifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
